main_definition: To commit oneself to and begin (a task or mission).

meanings_and_examples.definition: To take on a responsibility, typically a difficult one.
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to undertake the challenge of running a marathon.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To begin or initiate an action or task that requires effort or commitment.
meanings_and_examples.example: The team will undertake extensive research before launching their product.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To promise oneself to do something, often difficult or requiring perseverance.
meanings_and_examples.example: He undertook the task of learning a new language from scratch.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To engage in an activity that one has accepted voluntarily and is willing to carry out.
meanings_and_examples.example: The organization will undertake various community service projects throughout the year.
